poem:
Title: "Battle Cry From Odesa's Heart"

Through broad daylight's cruel conceit,
Odesa, wounded in the street.
Bitter rockets' brutal bloom,
Births shadows bearing death and doom.
Innocence in rubble stirred,
In Stefanchuk's plaintive word.
Speak now, nations, let it be,
Echoes of your empathy.
The hour is here, delay no more,
Turn back this darkened, warring shore.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war: at least 14 killed and 46 wounded in Odesa strike as Russian voting begins – live 1.03pm GMT Ruslan Stefanchuk, the chair of Ukraine’s parliament, has said today’s strike on Odesa shows “there should be no delay in supporting Ukraine”. He wrote: Odesa. In broad daylight, cynical Russian terrorists launched a rocket attack on the city. There are injured and dead. My sincere condolences to family and friends. Civilian infrastructure was damaged. Ukraine". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
